rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Awesome teacher, awesome person. Take whatever class she's teaching

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: loved his class
He grades on the low side, but his comments are extremely helpful. I don't remember the class having any drama with him. His office hours were always helpful and he is very helpful to work with.
Doesn't get a whole lot better than McFee.
he's just cocky. he thinks he knows everything there is to know about poetry, when he doesn't. he turned me off of poetry writing for a long time.

I have to agree with previous posters. McFee is the most pompous teacher I've ever encountered, and not a good teacher at that. When I compare him to writers at the national level, he doesn't even compare. Big fish in a small pond.

Since UNC has the WORST creative writing department in the USA, I would think some great patron would hope to improve it.  But when you are so bland that you can't hire REAL writers, but simply phony wanna-be appalachia fakes--what do you get?  A creative writing dept. that adds up to... NOTHING?  They hired a new football coach... what about ARTS?

This man is a pompous know-it-all. He had plenty of ideas about everything from my writing to my extra-curricular clubs and activities, and he let me know exactly what he felt I was doing wrong in every area. He tried to run the planning for a famous poet's reading (organized by a student group he had nothing to do with) and then didn't even come.
Plays favorites..
helped me develop my poetry hugely. he has been the best prof i've yet had at UNC
No Comments
He appears friendly at first, but he's really gossipy and secretly backstabs.  He gets petty and involved in his students' personal lives, but only so he can judge them later.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Chitwood was the worst creative writing professor that I had at UNC. His scope of understanding and creativity was limited, and the class itself was structured very inefficiently. We barely got to workshop, and many people didn't get comments back before having to turn in the next assignment. For a good class, take Shapiro or Seay, but not Chitwood
Mike is by far the best prof at UNC. He is super fair, the work load isn't too bad, and he has a fine wife.
